The hotels are located near the lake and being lake facing, adds more charm to the stay. The mall road is also next to the river which makes it a complete package. One can also visit the naina devi temple located on the other side of the river.

title: nothing great but its good
review: its avarage looking lake like all hill stations have , have some nice choice for vegeterian food... if u r tiered of eating same food of ur hotel,, boat ride is fun if its raining or cloudy.. they have beautiful view of rainbow in fog thats only in monthof may or june may b ...

title: Kids will love it
review: Though the lake had less water and was a bit dirty too at the banks, still the dragon / swan shape boats will fascinate kids....the level of water and the dirt will get addressed with rains.

title: Lakes and mountain combo is a good deal !
review: Mountains all around, showered with greenery and you are sitting in a boat listening to the enchanting of a mesmerizing sun kissed lake walking past your boat - the whole scene brings out from your heart a novice feeling of joy and this you can relish for long...

title: Pleasant Lake
review: This is the main attraction of Nainital - a hill station in India.

title: Exquisite
review: A beautiful lake with loads of boats to carry you on a wonderful dreamy ride...

title: A Must Do Activity in Nainital
review: This is a beautiful lake in the heart of Nainital. All the tourists coming to Nainital must take a ride in this lake. Boating facility is easily available here. From the boat, you can see the spectacular view of Nainital with Mountains all around. It looks nicer when the sky is covered with clouds. This is the biggest lake in Nainital. The other lakes are small and located at different parts of the city. This is the main attraction of Nainital.

title: Taalon mein Taal - Nainital
review: Let me start by saying it is serene, calming, inviting, welcoming. Nainital invites you by cool breeze hitting you face and calm water with an occasional ripple. Naini lake is surrounded by beautiful variety of trees. The streets are well maintained and clean.There is a cobbled road on the right side of naini lake, called as "Thandi Sadak". One can talk a walk here with loved one and spend hours looking at the lake. You see birds passing overhead, handful of ducks feeding and fish creating ripples on the surface as the come out to feed.

title: Majestic
review: It is a sausage shaped huge lake and is the centre of attraction of this town. Only if sail boats could be made accessible to general public as well.

title: Queen of hill stations
review: This is a wow place. Very popular yet not too badly exploited. There is a lot to see and do. This place has trained police and municipality to handle tourists. Would request people to avoid throwing fith around and use paid toilets instead of roadside leaks.

title: Beautiful View
review: I remember the time when Naini lake was so clean and beautiful around 15 years ago. But this time when I went there the lake water was very less as compared to before and i guess its the tourist who create the mess. Lake was having lot of garbage at the shores it was yakkk.

title: Busy but gotta do
review: some views of the lake from top are very scenic and pretty with so much greenery surrounding it.

title: super view and experience
review: awesome took boatride thrice..pleasant if you are in the boat even during hot summer.....good service..u can have a view of nainital while on the lake........................................................................

title: Early morning boat ride
review: Early morning boat ride is more satisfying as the sun is not bitter on you, the lake is calm and the atmosphere cool must visit the Naina Devi temple it costs 160 to 200 INR to have a full lake boating experience.

title: Good
review: Boating n club house is a good experience to launder about the day n till night huge activities for children in games room to enjoy as well cards room for oldies n youngsters can ponder about the bar ! Which is still in English style one with excellent food n huge variety in the bar

title: Excelent boat ride
review: A huge lake in the midts of city , fun boat rides.

title: Boating
review: there are lot of boats available for you try the self paddling boat its fun . I have rated this as average as there were strong winds blowing when we went out to boat and my brand new Reebok cap flew off and drowned in the lake.

title: Feeding to fishes
review: Feeding to fishes was amazing. Their acts looks great.

title: must do for naintial
review: Really enjoyed the boat ride. Great 'Indian' experience. The only negative was that I was handed a life vest that was sitting in vomit and didn't know until it was too late. Very gross have somebody's puke on my shirt. They workers at the boats didn't really do anything to help me out for their mistake.

title: boating is safe and pleasant
review: we went to naina devi temple and hired a boat @ Rs.160/-for four adults and a child. the boat man helped us to wear a life-jacket .the lake is very beautiful and boating view is nice.Then we went to other side of the lake and got up at the beneath of a

title: A must do thing in Nainital
review: For Rs 160, you can have a pleasant boat ride. The people are nice and it's an good experience and must do thing in Nainital. We took the boat from the bus stand side and also got dropped there. The boat man was nice and was telling us about the Nainital. It was a good experience and will definitely recommend.

title: Naini Lake
review: i was surprised to see clean water in the lake. no garbage,  plastic or weeds floating around. rates were fixed and controlled by association. surroundings of lake were also well maintained and clean. one can also hire yatchs..available till 4 pm

title: must visit for any couple / family
review: A peaceful clean lake (thanks to a DM some years back who discontinued use of plactic bags)

title: A place for an ideal retreat and unwinding
review: We stayed in hotel just besides this lake at Nainital for about 3 days and it was so pleasant and cool although we went there in the hot summer time. The boating there is something one would never miss and we used to frequent twice a day. At night time the surrounding looks excellent and the market is so jovial with it variety of candles and pottery and woolen items that it never finishes.

title: Good old charm of Boating
review: Biggest and most popular of all the lakes in the region... Naini lake has all the ingredients to pull the visitors through the sheer charm of its own. The lake is long and fun being with the family on a boat.. Word of caution, the ticket rate for full ride is Rs. 160, but the boatmen will return from 3/4th way in season time saying that they are only allowed till that distance. they do it so they can come back fast and get new customers... Typical of attitude of people from this place..

title: clean and beautiful
review: take the pedal or the row boats. Lake looks beautiful at night. Carry a DSLR and shoot the night light reflections on the lake.

title: A must go-- will visit again
review: The city is really well maintained, very clean and the authorities control most of the things. There is a fixed rate when you travel in Rickshaw from Tallital to Naintal, to get a rickshaw you need to be in a queue and police personnel help you get a rickshaw. Secondly they have restricted traffic in the Mall at certain times to allow visitors to easily move in and around the place. The municipal corporation has installed a number of seats just beside the lake and they make all effort to keep the place clean.

title: beautiful
review: Boating a must to admire the beauty. Naini temple is lovely.

title: Nice trip in boat
review: Rates are fixed by the government (Rs 160 per boat) for a row boat. Its advisable not to take a paddle boat as the wind may be strong and it may be tiresome. There are around 5 points for getting the boat. They provide life jackets which are dirty but is mandatory to wear.

title: lake nainital
review: A lot of water even in summer. boating pleasent but the approach is crowded and could be cleaner.the oxygen inlets look like thermal geysers from the cable car

title: Crystal clear beautiful lake
review: Very beautiful lake with boating facility, they are charging INR110 for half ride and 160 for full rides also you have to pay INR10 as jacket rental charge PP, purchase your tickets directly from counter and don't deal directly to boaters.

title: superb
review: wow best palace for romance,boating...very very  nice

title: Best Unique Attraction of Nainital
review: I would love to go again for naini lake... Awesome view and cool weather even in May.. I'd been there  in 2012 May.

title: Good hill station
review: Must visit place. I liked the boating part in Nani lake & mall road is a good time pass too.

title: Boating on the lake
review: A lazy afternoon spent boating on the lake is a good way to enjoy the holidays. The lake is quite large and the view is beautiful. However,if it gets crowded with too many boats that can spoil the fun a bit.

title: Amazing Place to visit
review: Nainital Lake is surrounded with seven mountains. Boating and Roapway is amazing

title: Naini lake
review: The lake is quite small and does not offer different views as one goes further away. The lakes in other cities like Chandigarh and Mahableshwar are better. But the kids had a good time. The authorities should make life jackets mandatory on all the boats.

title: Serene
review: The boating experience here seems very 'touristy' but one should go for it anyhow. You can take either the paddle boast of the one with oars and a boat dude (the guy who plows the oars).

title: A nice place
review: Good to visit in March-April or Oct-Nov when crowd is less and one can move freely. It would be cold ,more so if visiting places  further up and proper woollens are needed. Mukhteswar at 8000 feet above the sea level is such a place.

title: Awesome place
review: The sunrise from the mountain is beautiful... The view at night from the hotel is also very amazing... I liked it because it is covered from all places with the mountains. It snowed after 2 months which made it beautiful

title: Worth visiting
review: This lake was clean and beautiful.  We had a nice boat trip lasting half hour. You can do the ropeway and lake in one afternoon.

title: Always ready to visit again and again and again..
review: Love the drive from Delhi, the Naini lake, the all season weather, plenty of food joints, various day trip options.. Hate the ever growing tourist inflow...

title: Lake with a beauty within... Its actually Mango shape when seen from hill above...
review: Cold breeze flow from this lake to entire Nainital, in month of April the water is as cold as 10degrees.

title: Awesome experience
review: Naini lake surrounded by hill on one side & mall road on other side. enjoyed the paddle boating in the evening for a hour. Awesome experience. rates are reasonable & fixed by boat union. people are very friendly & cooperative. Life jackets are provided for the safety purpose.

title: Naini Lake - Attraction of Nainital.
review: Situated in the midst of the beatiful hill city, Naini Lake attracts a lot of visitors. Boat ride is also available for payment. There a lot of eating joints here and there. Small shops are here to buy merchandise of your choice.

title: Amazing Location
review: What a location Man,Awesum palce to chill up with Friends and Family.Noiseless and gives positive and relaxing feeling

title: Again any other hill station lake
review: Nothing special, just the boat rides as usual. However, the ticketing system and the boat rowers are good. It is organised withut any chaos. The street market on the entry side of the lake do not have much variety and are very costly. The Naini Devi Temple on the lake corner is worth visiting

title: clean and well maintained by the authorities.
review: The lake is clean and kept that way by the authorities. I was impressed by the strict enforcement of the no-littering diktat which was evidenced by all vendors selling eatables insisting that you dispose the remnant plates and leftovers in the dustbins kept by them. The lake as a result is clean and non-odorous, The rates for boating in the lake are fixed and prominently displayed to prevent tourists from being fleeced. The lakeside is ringed by a sidewalk for those wanting to walk along it, dotted by frequent benches if one wants to sit and enjoy the sunset or sunrise. Overall, one of the better maintained tourist spot that I have seen in India.

title: perfect for a break from citylife
review: Good option for a weekend getaway. There are not many sightseeing options in Nainital..it can all be covered in a day. Look at it to relax with a steaming cup of coffee and a book. Must do's are boating in Naini lake and rope car. Loads of handicrafts and woolens but be at your bargaining best. I went during offseason so I walked off with good deals. Must eats is the roadside bread omellette and steaming espresso coffees - local and not in CCD's. Food is generally amazing with a major punjabi touch. Try to take hotels closer to the lake for convenience as there are quite a few steep climbs. Otherwise its a small place. Those interested can go for a drive to Bhimtal and saattal but its d same..a lake in each lacale..go for the drive on the mountain roads and do not expect much on these spots. Beware of touts and do not give in to whatever price they ask for to take you around.

title: Lake with tides
review: A big enough lake with a lot of ripples.Try feeding the fishes(there are a lot of them ) from the alley next to the cinema hall. Make sure you take a boat ride. The weather changes very quickly so make sure you are carrying enough woolens.

title: District of Lakes
review: Beautiful destination for a quick weekend getaway!

title: nainital is very good hill station
review: nainital is very good hill station near by delhi, u just drive 6 hrs,u reach out there , u can visit to beauty full mall road , naini lake, bhemtal 7 tall, sonw view , some time u can visit to ranikhet is near by nainital just travel 2 hrs.over all good stay out there.

title: lake not as pretty
review: Dissappointed. Too crowded with too many vendors.Lake was green not blue water & not as extensive as I had seen it in the past.

title: Boating is very Romantic!!
review: The Lake is Beautiful and one can enjoy the boating dere... Both by a sailor or a paddle boat!! The Travel agents will come to you and irritate u a lot. But u have to chose the right one... The rates can be HIGHLY bargained. [rates for the local sightseeing]

title: Nanini Lake
review: this lake is very beautifull and inside the lake lots of fish i wish i can catch some fishes from from lake but its not allowed always there is police petroling in this area i feed slice bread to fishes and this looks very very beautifull form top

title: Good to see lake
review: Please go in afternoon time only where there is a good sunlight else you would be freezed, its chilly cold especially in jan month.

title: Green Emerald nestled in Hills!
review: Enjoy rowing or better still, Yachting. Yachts are available at the Boathouse Club. Avoid garish paddle boats.

title: Ultimate experience
review: I visited nainital in October 2011 and naini Lake just made my trip. Since, it was starting of winter season...So temperature was really good... Boating in the evening makes you feel awesome... It gives a nice visual and boat actually covers a fair distance.

title: Nainital -A paradise town
review: Nainital is one of the many nice towns in north India where one can enjoy the scenic beauty  of nature. There are many places to visit including some points wherein one can behold the nature in awe and behold what is called as nature. Places to visit are the horse trek through the jungle, going up the highest point which is Naini Peak via the cable car where one can view the Himalayas in the foreground and of course enjoy boating in the Naini lake. The market is also a good place to buy souvenier and one should bring back some candles as its local made and a good item for display at your home. Ideal time to visit is Apr -June  and Sept -Nov .Winters are very cold out here.

title: Nice lake
review: Good place for boating and children loved feeding a lot of ducks at the banks

title: You've got to take a boat ride here!
review: Naini Lake is a refreshing mile long stretch of water, mirroring the sky above. It's what gives the town its charm. Walk around it or indulge in a boat ride to get a feel of its beauty.

title: chill on hill
review: u will find here an elegant nature with awesome climate. The naini lake is main center of attraction and the next place is himalaya darshan

title: Take a Stroll
review: Lake is a big lake, where you can take a stroll around the lake. It is really good and i suggest that every one going to nainital must do so. Their are so many hawkers and vendors who kind of pasture you at times.

title: Excellent location for someone looking for a serene hill station far from noisy city environment
review: The Naini Lake, The mini treks, The mist covered mountains, Walking through clouds...you can experience all of these.

title: Princtine Lake with good number of boats
review: Since we visited this place just before the on set of a tourism season, there was no mad rush for boats. For Rs. 150/- you can enjoy an hour long boat ride which will definitely refresh you. The swans floating around you while you are peddling your boat, or Swans swimming alongside in the lake while you are having your morning walk on Mall road, both are spectacular views. The Lake has been restored recently and water quality is ok. At least there is no stinking water considering its a closed water body.

title: Nainitaal - Like a paradise on earth
review: Talking about the taal that is the lake, it is aussum place to visit. We used to go there every day in the evening to have a walk near the lake. Boating is a good option. Their is a NaiNa Devi Temple there, which is also very good. and the authorities have maintained the lake area very well.

title: Lake darshan from thandi sadak
review: Lakes are great but when you combine Lakes with mountains - the combination is unbeatable !

title: Litter Free
review: Surprisingly litter free and well maintained. The compact lake is pretty.

title: heaven on earth
review: nanitaal is the valey of lakes, nani lake is the famous of all , its in the shape of an eye and looks very beautiful, the best time to visit nanitaal is mid july - october.

title: All the lakes in this region MUST be seen
review: I saw all the lakes in this region from Nainital to other smaller villages in the area. ALL must be seen. The way my partner and I went about it is by getting a tour throught he area. We found a tour guide on Mall Road Nainital (Surya Travel) and they gave us the car and the driver (who was not a crazy driver and was very careful driving up and down the mountain side -- top bloke!). He took us to every lake and th journey between lakes was to die for. The scenery in this area was stunning!

title: The Best Place to Visit
review: Nainital has a "Naini" lake. This lake has been divided into two portions, one called Talli tal and another Malli tal. The whole of the hustle bustle lies around this lake, and there is nothing more interesting elsewhere except the cable car ride to the Snow Peak view of Nanda Devi peak.

title: A Beautiful Eye SHape Lake
review: When I saw first time the Lake, I was soundless. The Beautiful Lake is swirling. Everybody should visit the place once in a life. Real charm of seeing the Full lake is from mountains besides Nainital. Local texi drivers can bring you there. You can preview the view which I saw.

title: Boat Ride & Mall Road
review: While in Nainital, one has to enjoy a boat ride. A fun activity for kids and grown ups alike.

title: Beautiful lake
review: A beautiful mango shaped lake in the heart of the town. Boating facility is available. There are options of paddle boat and usual boat.

title: The lake visit in Nainital .
review: Just like forever , when we were young children . Still the fun of boating and rowing remains and it is the heart of Nainital rippling in its pristine beauty .

title: One of the most Beautiful lake
review: Nainital lake is one of the beautiful lake I have seen. The colourful boats and the mountains enhances its beauty. If you are a photography loving person you will never stop clicking photos of the lake and surrounding beauty. While boating in the lake you can have a complete view of the Nainital city and the mountains decorated with colourful cottages all around. The Tibetan market helps you to spend some time in shopping where you can find good warm cloths and toys for your kids. Even you can enjoy the Butta and chai as well. The people are so sweet and helpful in Nainital. Every year I visit this beautiful city and I every time I enjoyed it.

title: Best lake
review: Nice, clean full of energy. The boating in Nainital lake is an experience in itself and is a must for every visitor.

title: naini lake
review: nainital as a town derives its names from this lake which is main water body around which there is a lot of buzz and action. most of the tourists are found strolling around the lake and there are hundreds of eating joints surrounding it.

title: Nice experience!!
review: Boating in Naini lake is most amazing experience for kids.we enjoyed a lot..

title: Very pleasant
review: I have been a regular visitor to Nainital since 1975. One was sad to see the declining cleanliness and the crumbling infrastructure.This visit was after a gap of a few years and what a pleasant surprise!

title: Wow.
review: 33 Kms. From Kathgodam, Nainital Lake is a natural freshwater mango shaped flora/fauna enriched lake, surrounded by hills.

title: Words can't explain the beauty of nainital lake!
review: Nainital lake is known for its exquisiteness. Lying on the lap of kumayun range of Himalaya, one side is hill side covered with pine forests and the other side is nainital town. It's a must visit for tourists who likes hill station.
